00040 class CPUDevice : public Device
00041 {
00042 public:
00043     vector<thread*> threads;
00044     ThreadQueue<DeviceTask> tasks;
00045     KernelGlobals *kg;
00046     
00047     CPUDevice(int threads_num)
00048     {
00049         kg = kernel_globals_create();
00050 
00051         /* do now to avoid thread issues */
00052         system_cpu_support_optimized();
00053 
00054         if(threads_num == 0)
00055             threads_num = system_cpu_thread_count();
00056 
00057         threads.resize(threads_num);
00058 
00059         for(size_t i = 0; i < threads.size(); i++)
00060             threads[i] = new thread(function_bind(&CPUDevice::thread_run, this, i));
00061     }
00062 
00063     ~CPUDevice()
00064     {
00065         tasks.stop();
00066 
00067         foreach(thread *t, threads) {
00068             t->join();
00069             delete t;
00070         }
00071 
00072         kernel_globals_free(kg);
00073     }
00074 
00075     bool support_advanced_shading()
00076     {
00077         return true;
00078     }
00079 
00080     void mem_alloc(device_memory& mem, MemoryType type)
00081     {
00082         mem.device_pointer = mem.data_pointer;
00083     }
00084 
00085     void mem_copy_to(device_memory& mem)
00086     {
00087         /* no-op */
00088     }
00089 
00090     void mem_copy_from(device_memory& mem, int y, int w, int h, int elem)
00091     {
00092         /* no-op */
00093     }
00094 
00095     void mem_zero(device_memory& mem)
00096     {
00097         memset((void*)mem.device_pointer, 0, mem.memory_size());
00098     }
00099 
00100     void mem_free(device_memory& mem)
00101     {
00102         mem.device_pointer = 0;
00103     }
00104 
00105     void const_copy_to(const char *name, void *host, size_t size)
00106     {
00107         kernel_const_copy(kg, name, host, size);
00108     }
00109 
00110     void tex_alloc(const char *name, device_memory& mem, bool interpolation, bool periodic)
00111     {
00112         kernel_tex_copy(kg, name, mem.data_pointer, mem.data_width, mem.data_height);
00113         mem.device_pointer = mem.data_pointer;
00114     }
00115 
00116     void tex_free(device_memory& mem)
00117     {
00118         mem.device_pointer = 0;
00119     }
00120 
00121     void *osl_memory()
00122     {
00123 #ifdef WITH_OSL
00124         return kernel_osl_memory(kg);
00125 #else
00126         return NULL;
00127 #endif
00128     }
00129 
00130     void thread_run(int t)
00131     {
00132         DeviceTask task;
00133 
00134         while(tasks.worker_wait_pop(task)) {
00135             if(task.type == DeviceTask::PATH_TRACE)
00136                 thread_path_trace(task);
00137             else if(task.type == DeviceTask::TONEMAP)
00138                 thread_tonemap(task);
00139             else if(task.type == DeviceTask::SHADER)
00140                 thread_shader(task);
00141 
00142             tasks.worker_done();
00143         }
00144     }
00145 
00146     void thread_path_trace(DeviceTask& task)
00147     {
00148         if(tasks.worker_cancel())
00149             return;
00150 
00151 #ifdef WITH_OSL
00152         if(kernel_osl_use(kg))
00153             OSLShader::thread_init(kg);
00154 #endif
00155 
00156 #ifdef WITH_OPTIMIZED_KERNEL
00157         if(system_cpu_support_optimized()) {
00158             for(int y = task.y; y < task.y + task.h; y++) {
00159                 for(int x = task.x; x < task.x + task.w; x++)
00160                     kernel_cpu_optimized_path_trace(kg, (float*)task.buffer, (unsigned int*)task.rng_state,
00161                         task.sample, x, y, task.offset, task.stride);
00162 
00163                 if(tasks.worker_cancel())
00164                     break;
00165             }
00166         }
00167         else
00168 #endif
00169         {
00170             for(int y = task.y; y < task.y + task.h; y++) {
00171                 for(int x = task.x; x < task.x + task.w; x++)
00172                     kernel_cpu_path_trace(kg, (float*)task.buffer, (unsigned int*)task.rng_state,
00173                         task.sample, x, y, task.offset, task.stride);
00174 
00175                 if(tasks.worker_cancel())
00176                     break;
00177             }
00178         }
00179 
00180 #ifdef WITH_OSL
00181         if(kernel_osl_use(kg))
00182             OSLShader::thread_free(kg);
00183 #endif
00184     }
00185 
00186     void thread_tonemap(DeviceTask& task)
00187     {
00188 #ifdef WITH_OPTIMIZED_KERNEL
00189         if(system_cpu_support_optimized()) {
00190             for(int y = task.y; y < task.y + task.h; y++)
00191                 for(int x = task.x; x < task.x + task.w; x++)
00192                     kernel_cpu_optimized_tonemap(kg, (uchar4*)task.rgba, (float*)task.buffer,
00193                         task.sample, task.resolution, x, y, task.offset, task.stride);
00194         }
00195         else
00196 #endif
00197         {
00198             for(int y = task.y; y < task.y + task.h; y++)
00199                 for(int x = task.x; x < task.x + task.w; x++)
00200                     kernel_cpu_tonemap(kg, (uchar4*)task.rgba, (float*)task.buffer,
00201                         task.sample, task.resolution, x, y, task.offset, task.stride);
00202         }
00203     }
00204 
00205     void thread_shader(DeviceTask& task)
00206     {
00207 #ifdef WITH_OSL
00208         if(kernel_osl_use(kg))
00209             OSLShader::thread_init(kg);
00210 #endif
00211 
00212 #ifdef WITH_OPTIMIZED_KERNEL
00213         if(system_cpu_support_optimized()) {
00214             for(int x = task.shader_x; x < task.shader_x + task.shader_w; x++) {
00215                 kernel_cpu_optimized_shader(kg, (uint4*)task.shader_input, (float4*)task.shader_output, task.shader_eval_type, x);
00216 
00217                 if(tasks.worker_cancel())
00218                     break;
00219             }
00220         }
00221         else
00222 #endif
00223         {
00224             for(int x = task.shader_x; x < task.shader_x + task.shader_w; x++) {
00225                 kernel_cpu_shader(kg, (uint4*)task.shader_input, (float4*)task.shader_output, task.shader_eval_type, x);
00226 
00227                 if(tasks.worker_cancel())
00228                     break;
00229             }
00230         }
00231 
00232 #ifdef WITH_OSL
00233         if(kernel_osl_use(kg))
00234             OSLShader::thread_free(kg);
00235 #endif
00236     }
00237 
00238     void task_add(DeviceTask& task)
00239     {
00240         /* split task into smaller ones, more than number of threads for uneven
00241            workloads where some parts of the image render slower than others */
00242         task.split(tasks, threads.size()*10);
00243     }
00244 
00245     void task_wait()
00246     {
00247         tasks.wait_done();
00248     }
00249 
00250     void task_cancel()
00251     {
00252         tasks.cancel();
00253     }
00254 };
00255 
00256 Device *device_cpu_create(DeviceInfo& info, int threads)
00257 {
00258     return new CPUDevice(threads);
00259 }
00260 
00261 void device_cpu_info(vector<DeviceInfo>& devices)
00262 {
00263     DeviceInfo info;
00264 
00265     info.type = DEVICE_CPU;
00266     info.description = system_cpu_brand_string();
00267     info.id = "CPU";
00268     info.num = 0;
00269     info.advanced_shading = true;
00270 
00271     devices.insert(devices.begin(), info);
00272 }
